author: nishant0
content: yeah the metadata issue is a bit complicated

author: nishant0
content: we can fix it for teku, but other prysm peers will not like us anymore

author: nishant0
content: hmm, testing this out in altona and both lighthouse and prysm do not like it

author: protolambda
content: are you closing the write side, or the both write and read?

author: nishant0
content: just write

author: nishant0
content:
for lighthouse a lot of peers respond with `i/o deadline exceeded` errors, while prysm peers return with 
`stream resets`

author: protolambda
content: And if you send a byte, then close write side? Is it dependent on sending any contents?

author: nishant0
content: i can give that a try and see if it helps

author: nishant0
content: at least in prysm, we dont expect any data to be sent in metadata requests

author: protolambda
content: Yea, that would be best, just want to know if the state machine of write/read closing is affected by contents in any way

author: nishant0
content: ok it seems prysm and lighthouse are fine with it, but another client is complaining

author: nishant0
content: although I am not sure which client it is

author: nishant0
content: there was no agent version there

author: nishant0
content: also a lot of its nodes had the port set to `30303`

author: nishant0
content:
<@!203220829473996800> what protocols does rumour speak, is it:
```
          "/eth2/beacon_chain/req/ping/1/ssz_snappy",
          "/eth2/beacon_chain/req/metadata/1/ssz_snappy",
          "/eth2/beacon_chain/req/status/1/ssz_snappy",
          "/meshsub/1.1.0"
```
?

author: protolambda
content: 30303 sounds like a geth node

author: nishant0
content: yeah it was a bit wierd

author: protolambda
content: rumor doesn't speak anything unless you ask it too

author: protolambda
content: and the bootnode is not rumor, but even more minimal

author: nishant0
content: So when you start rumour up, which protocols are registered ?

author: protolambda
content: None

author: protolambda
content: Well, libp2p identify, if you don't disable it

author: protolambda
content: might be lodestar?

author: nishant0
content: hmm, how does it participate in the network then ? if it gets a status request , what does rumour do

author: nishant0
content: not sure if its lodestar, I would expect it to have more protocols registered

author: protolambda
content: You can enable all those things, and some with greater automation too. But not sure why you're thinking about rumor? Is the behavior you see really that odd?

author: nishant0
content: Main reason was it looked like a non-client

author: nishant0
content: so I assumed it was rumour

author: protolambda
content: Do you have the IP of the weird node?

author: nishant0
content: I do, give me a sec

author: nishant0
content: I will dm you them

author: protolambda
content: üëç

author: nishant0
content:
Ok bootnodes have been changed, and double checked with rumour, so they should be good now. 
https://github.com/goerli/medalla/pull/36
https://github.com/eth2-clients/eth2-testnets/pull/22
